intro: Ruschia ferox, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a valuable addition to arid landscapes.
